derivation.yuyuan_name: early 20th cent.: from Chinese gāoliang, from gāo 'high' + liáng 'fine grain'

means.word_mean: 1. sorghums of China and Manchuria having small white or brown grains (used for food) and dry pithy stalks (used for fodder, fuel and thatching)
